text: The Olympic flag at the closing ceremony of the 2012 Summer Olympics. This is the list of International Olympic Committee (IOC) meetings. ==Olympic Congresses== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:left;" |- !# !City Host !Country !Year |- ||1st||Paris||||1894 |- ||2nd||Le Havre||||1897 |- ||3rd ||Brussels||||1905 |- ||4th||Paris||||1906 |- ||5th ||Lausanne||||1913 |- ||6th ||Paris||||1914 |- ||7th||Lausanne||||1921 |- ||8th||Prague||||1925 |- ||9th||Berlin||||1930 |- ||10th||Varna||||1973 |- ||11th ||Baden-Baden||||1981 |- ||12th ||Paris||||1994 |- ||13th||Copenhagen||||2009 |} ==IOC Sessions== There has been a session during all Olympic Games except the 1900, 1904 and 1908 Summer Olympics and the 1924, 1928 and 1932 Winter Olympics. {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text- align:left; font-size:88%" |- !Session !Year !Host city !Olympic occasion !Activities !Ref |- |style="text-align:center; background:#BBF3BB"|1st ||style="text-align:center"|1894 || Paris, France | I Olympic Congress |Athens of Greece was selected as the host for the Games of the I Olympiad. The Youth Olympic Games was created. |style="text-align:center"| |- |style="text-align:center"|120th ||style="text-align:center"|2008 || Beijing, China | Games of the XXIX Olympiad | |style="text-align:center"| |- |style="text-align:center; background:#FFFFBB"|121st ||style="text- align:center"|2009 || Copenhagen, Denmark | XIII Olympic Congress |Rio de Janeiro of Brazil was selected as the host for the Games of the XXXI Olympiad. Rogge was re-elected as the President of the International Olympic Committee for the second term. Golf and rugby had been readmitted to the Olympic programme in 2016. |style="text-align:center"| |- |style="text-align:center; background:#BBF3BB"|122nd ||style="text-align:center"|2010 || Vancouver, Canada | XXI Olympic Winter Games |Nanjing of China was selected as the host for the 2nd Summer Youth Olympic Games. |style="text-align:center"| |- |style="text-align:center; background:#BBF3BB"|123rd ||style="text- align:center"|2011 || Durban, South Africa |style="background:#ECECEC"|Separate occasion |Pyeongchang of South Korea was selected as the host for the XXIII Olympic Winter Games. |style="text- align:center"| |- |style="text-align:center"|124th ||style="text- align:center"|2012 || London, Great Britain | Games of the XXX Olympiad | |style="text-align:center"| |- |style="text-align:center; background:#BBF3BB"|Ext ||style="text-align:center"|2013 || Lausanne, Switzerland |style="background:#ECECEC"|Separate occasion |Buenos Aires of Argentina was selected as the host for the 3rd Summer Youth Olympic Games. |style="text-align:center"| |- |style="text-align:center; background:#FFFFBB"|125th ||style="text-align:center"|2013 || Buenos Aires, Argentina |style="background:#ECECEC"|Separate occasion |Tokyo of Japan was selected as the host for the Games of the XXXII Olympiad. The German Thomas Bach was elected as the ninth President of the International Olympic Committee. Wrestling had been selected to the Olympic programme for 2020 and 2024. |style="text-align:center"| |- |style="text-align:center"|126th ||style="text- align:center"|2014 || Sochi, Russia | XXII Olympic Winter Games |Olympic Agenda 2020, the strategic roadmap for the future of the Olympic Movement initiated by Thomas Bach, had been discussed. |style="text-align:center"| |- |style="text-align:center"|127th ||style="text-align:center"|2014 || Monte Carlo, Monaco |style="background:#ECECEC"|Separate occasion |The Extraordinary Session was hosted by IOC member Albert II, Prince of Monaco. The International Olympic Committee discussed Bach's Olympic Agenda 2020. |style="text-align:center"| |- |style="text-align:center; background:#BBF3BB"|128th ||style="text-align:center"|2015 || Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia |style="background:#ECECEC"|Separate occasion |Beijing of China was selected as the host for the XXIV Olympic Winter Games. Lausanne of Switzerland was selected as the host for the 3rd Winter Youth Olympic Games. |style="text-align:center"| |- |style="text-align:center"|129th ||style="text-align:center"|2016 || Rio de Janeiro, Brazil | Games of the XXXI Olympiad |The five new sports, including baseball/softball, karate, sport climbing, surfing, skateboarding, for 2020 were approved. |style="text- align:center"| |- |style="text-align:center"|130th ||style="text- align:center"|2017 || Lausanne, Switzerland |style="background:#ECECEC"|Separate occasion |Joint-awarding of the Games of the XXXIII Olympiad and the Games of the XXXIV Olympiad was approved. Bidding process for XXV Olympic Winter Games was approved. |style="text- align:center"| |- |style="text-align:center; background:#BBF3BB"|131st ||style="text-align:center"|2017 || Lima, Peru |style="background:#ECECEC"|Separate occasion |Paris of France was selected as the host for the Games of the XXXIII Olympiad. Los Angeles of the United States was selected as the host for the Games of the XXXIV Olympiad. |style="text-align:center"| |- |style="text- align:center"|132nd ||style="text-align:center"|2018 || Pyeongchang, South Korea | XXIII Olympic Winter Games |The date of the 4th Summer Youth Olympic Games was reverted from 2023 to 2022. The International Olympic Committee suggested an African city should be host the 4th Summer Youth Olympic Games. |style="text-align:center"| |- |style="text-align:center; background:#BBF3BB"|133rd ||style="text- align:center"|2018 || Buenos Aires, Argentina | 3rd Summer Youth Olympic Games |Dakar of Senegal was selected as the host for the 4th Summer Youth Olympic Games. |style="text-align:center"| |- |style="text-align:center; background:#BBF3BB"|134th ||style="text-align:center"|2019 || Lausanne, Switzerland |style="background:#ECECEC"|Separate occasion |Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo of Italy was selected as the host for the XXV Olympic Winter Games. |style="text-align:center"| |- |style="text-align:center; background:#BBF3BB"|135th ||style="text-align:center"|2020 || Lausanne, Switzerland | 3rd Winter Youth Olympic Games |Gangwon Province of South Korea was selected as the host for the 4th Winter Youth Olympic Games. |style="text- align:center"| |- |style="text-align:center"|136th ||style="text- align:center"|2020 ||Virtual Session |style="background:#ECECEC"|Separate occasion |The postponement of the 4th Summer Youth Olympic Games from 2022 to 2026 was approved. |style="text-align:center"| |- |style="text-align:center;
